III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth A was sexually abused by a peer at the facility during his
stay. The peer did this to other youth in the home as well.
Investigation Therapist was interviewed via phone on 4/2/2025. Therapist
reported working at Youth’s A current placement. Youth A
disclosed in session that during his stay at the facility another
youth sexually abused him. Therapist reported Youth A declined
to share the name of the youth who abused him and did not share
any further details including where or when the incident occurred.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his current placement on
5/2/2025. After explaining why he was being interviewed, he
asked if this was about him being raped. He reported sexual
things happened, but he did not want to talk about it, and he
wasn’t going to provide any details. Youth A reported the incident
occurred between 3 and 5 years ago while he was residing at
Methodist with another youth in which he was pushed down.
Youth A declined to share further details including the name of the
youth or name any staff witnesses. Youth A reported the incident
occurred when he was playing X-box in the back part of the
cottage over the span of approximately 5 minutes. Youth A stated
that staff were nearby but did not see the other youth push him.
Youth A reported not telling a staff when it occurred due to being
threatened by the youth who pushed him. Youth A reported telling
a staff he wanted to go to his room after the incident occurred and
staff let him. Youth A declined to share if he was hurt during the
incident or if anything additional to being pushed occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/3/2025.
Staff 1 reported she has worked at the facility for 10 years. Staff 1
denied recollection of any incidents or allegations that any youth
had engaged in sexual contact with other youth at the facility over
the course of her employment. Staff 1 denied awareness of
allegations regarding Youth A having been sexually abused by
any other youth at the facility. Staff 1 reported bed checks have
been required during sleeping hours and were in 2019 and 2020
at least every 10 to 15 minutes. Staff 1 reported youth have
always had their own bedrooms at the facility. Staff 1 reported
staff station themselves between the bedrooms while youth are in
their bedrooms and can see into the rooms from there.
Chief Administrator and Director were interviewed face to face at
the facility on 4/3/25 and both reported not being employed during
Youth A’s placement at Methodist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Reports regarding Youth A were reviewed. Review
of IRs dated 9/17/19-1/16/20 revealed 20 incidents with 5
regarding sexualized behaviors where Youth A made
2

inappropriate sexual comment and 1 incident in which
Youth A grabbed another youth’s private parts. There were
no incident reports where Youth A was victim.
• Updated Service Plan dated 1/16/2020 documents
sexualized behaviors for Youth A with sexual abuse history
marked unknown.
• MCHS Admission Notification for Youth A documents
possible past sexualized behavior as well as being a
possible past sexual abuse victim.
• MCHS Family of Services Staffing Policy states that the
facility has a staffing ratio of 3:1 for youth during waking
hours and 10:1 during sleeping hours.
• Youth A’s file was reviewed. Youth A was placed in the
facility from 6/20/19 until 8/12/20.
•
Analysis There is not sufficient evidence to support any rule violations. Staff
who were employed at the facility in the timeframe referenced
denied any awareness of possible sexual abuse incidents with
Youth A or any other youth. All incident reports regarding Youth A
were reviewed as well as service plans which show a history of
sexualized behaviors for Youth A. Youth A was interviewed
declined to provide specific information including any names of
youth or staff present during any incidents.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted following an allegation that a youth, referred to as Youth A, was sexually abused by a peer at the Methodist Children's Home several years prior. The investigation found insufficient evidence to substantiate the claims, as the youth declined to provide specific details or names, current staff had no recollection of such incidents, and a review of records from the time period showed no reports of Youth A as a victim. Given the lack of corroborating evidence and the explicit conclusion of the state investigator, no policy or code violations were established against the facility.
